intro: Eremohylema, commonly known as the desert holly, is a genus of flowering plants in the family Aizoaceae. It is native to arid and semi-arid regions of southern Africa, where it thrives in harsh, dry environments. The plants are characterized by their succulent leaves and showy, often pink or red, flowers that bloom in late summer. Eremohylema species are typically low-growing, forming dense mats or shrubs to conserve moisture and withstand high temperatures. These plants play an important role in stabilizing sandy soils and providing habitat for desert wildlife.
